docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: New research on teen-age mothers has produced seemingly contradictory results and created confusion and concern among those working to prevent teen-age pregnancy.

headline.main: Studies Cause Confusion on Impact of Teen-Age Pregnancy

docs.snippet: LEAD: New research on teen-age mothers has produced seemingly contradictory results and created confusion and concern among those working to prevent teen-age pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Tax Reform Act of 1986 was intended to simplify the nation's tax code, making economics rather than taxes the basis for financial decisions. Frederick Andrews, business-financial editor of The New York Times, and Jan M. Rosen, editor of this supplement, interviewed three leading practitioners about how they are now advising clients in such key areas as retirement planning, saving for their children's education, investing and home ownership.

headline.main: An Experts' Roundtable - Tax Strategies for Today
